body.name: Tramontina Kitchen Knife Set Forged 3 Pc, 80008/020DS
features: Set Includes: 4 in Paring Knife, 6 in Utility Knife & 8 in Chef’s Knife
Full-tang construction–forged from ice-hardened, high-carbon, stainless steel
Fully tapered and beveled, hand-honed blade with fine edge and satin finish
Black polycarbonate handle assembled with three heavy-duty rivets
body.description: Be prepared for any kitchen tasks from prepping main courses to creating beautiful dessert, thanks to Tramontina’s Forged 3 Pc Kitchen Knife Set. You’ll be ready to tackle daily tasks, like peeling fruit, chopping vegetables, and slicing bread. This set also gives you the right tools to trim meat and score delicate pastries. Each piece is constructed from one single bar of durable high-carbon stainless steel for perfect heft and balance. The knives are also fully tapered and beveled, and hand-honed to a fine edge with a satin finish. Black polycarbonate handles assembled with three heavy-duty rivets gives you easy maneuverability, and clean-up is easy too! Each piece is dishwasher safe. Made in Brazil.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sharpest knives I own
reviews.reviewText: Out of the box these are the sharpest knives I own. I thought that the knives I had been using were sharp but there's no comparison. Food prep is so much easier with the Tramontina's. Whether I can keep them sharp is a different question. Best knives for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent quality, unbelievable value for money
reviews.reviewText: I've bought those more than a year ago. This set is as good as many of the top-tier brands, for a fraction of the price. The 8'' chef's knife in particular became my go-to knife, and I cook a lot. Excellent purchase, highly recommended

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like these knives, good price for good quality

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice set ...
reviews.reviewText: I've purchased this brand years ago and thought they were good then. They're still good quality.These three knives are quite nice. Each comes with a sheath and is nicely made -- excellent quality for the price. They're a bit larger than I expected -- I use mostly the small and medium sizes -- but they round out my knife collection just fine.Would definitely purchase again. Also, they would make a nice "starter set" for someone moving into their first apartment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good vacation knife set, the 8" chef's is gold
reviews.reviewText: The contemporary grip is very nice and the bigger grip of the 8" chef's is almost perfect. It is a great knife, perhaps the equal of the Henckels I grew up using 40 years ago. I am going to get the 7" santuko and if the grips are as large it will be a winner. As good as it is, it would still benefit from a 10% bump in grip size. As far as the others in his set, unfortunately knifemakers seem to think like screwdriver makers do and assume if the blade is small the grip should be small. Human hands beg to differ; they want one size, one comfortable fit for even the smaller size blades. Notwithstanding, a great starter set or vacation home set. Super sharp, super value

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best value in German style knives
reviews.reviewText: If Amazon allowed it, this would be a 4.5 star review. If you are looking at these knives, you are probably in the market for German style forged knives at a more affordable price than the actual German knife makers. In that market, Mercer is the big player and Tramontina is often overlooked. But the Brazilians are running an old world forge down there and the under twenty five dollar price for this set of three is hard to beat. Note that I am ignoring the "budget" lines that Zwilling and Wustoff make in China; I do have some experience with those and I do not recommend.I have a fairly ridiculous collection of kitchen knives and these are not the equal of those. But once you factor in price, I think this set is an excellent value. I bought these to give to a family member who has the most atrocious set of knives imaginable and I expect them to give good service for many years. I was not sold on the handle to look at it, but I found it to be pretty comfortable if you use a pinch grip.The negatives I found included a chip in the handle that should not have cleared quality control. The spine of the knife is not rounded at all and is fairly sharp. The full old-style bolster will make future sharpening (which will be me) a pain. When you factor in that this set of three cost about 25% of the cost of a basic German chef knife, those issues come into perspective and don't seem so bad.All three knives came with pretty decent sheaths, which was an unexpected bonus. I think this set is ideal for college students, people starting out with cooking, as a traveling set when you stay in AirBnB type places, or knives for family members who have no idea what a good knife is like.I don't have any Mercer knives, so I cannot directly compare, but this set of three was still less than the cost of one forged Mercer Chef knife. For the price I paid for these I am pleased. They are likely better than the knives in 75% of homes and cost less than a good bottle of wine. I am honestly tempted to buy another set to run in my own kitchen just to see how well they do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021
reviews.reviewText: These knifes cut so smoothly and very sharp so helps me to be really precise, they are not too heavy but has a good weight to allow you to cut properly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Probably best bang for the buck
reviews.reviewText: I like everything about this knife. Definitely they are worth buying

reviews.reviewTitle: Mesmas facas da linha Design Collection/Prochef, só que mais barato
reviews.reviewText: Facas robustas e com aço de qualidade. Faca de ofício um pouco grande, está mais pra faca de filetar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mismatched branding and less legible printing on one of the knives...
reviews.reviewText: This knife "set", if you can actually call that a "set" since not all of the knives have the same branding, would not be so bad if the quality and appearance of the knives would be consistent...The Chef's knife is as good as I would expect it to be in this price range, nothing wrong with it as far as I can tell..There are unfortunately problems with the Utility knife and the Paring knife...The Utility knife is not branded Tamontina but BHG (which might be a distributor of Tramontina according to my research) and the print quality on the Paring knife is not as good as the other two knifes...I contacted Tramontina and this is NOT a product that they sell in Canada so your only recourse if there is a problem is Amazon as they will not be able to help...If it was not for these problems I would probably have given them a 4 as they are relatively good and even come with sheaths but because of these problems they look like mismatched knives which I would have not bought if I had known this is what I was getting...
